Articles.Content:
I tried posting a new thread for Japanese speakers to the international forum a few (three?) days ago. I was told the post would need to approved before being posted but have heard nothing since.

I then tried to contact an international forum moderator to check up on the situation, but the only one I could find told me he was no longer a moderator...

So what do we need to do about posting new threads, and who do we contact if we need to speak to a moderator? (I thought they would be listed here somewhere but I cannot find it!)

I tried posting a new thread for Japanese speakers to the international forum a few (three?) days ago. I was told the post would need to approved before being posted but have heard nothing since.

I then tried to contact an international forum moderator to check up on the situation, but the only one I could find told me he was no longer a moderator...

So what do we need to do about posting new threads, and who do we contact if we need to speak to a moderator? (I thought they would be listed here somewhere but I cannot find it!)

You can look through the individual international forums, most of us are active there

Your thread probably ended up washed up for some reason. Fortunately, you are now at three posts, this means you no longer need to get your posts approved by us. Go ahead and post it again it should appear straight away

You can look through the individual international forums, most of us are active there

Your thread probably ended up washed up for some reason. Fortunately, you are now at three posts, this means you no longer need to get your posts approved by us. Go ahead and post it again it should appear straight away

Thanks. I did wonder if it was a "new members only" restriction.

Unfortunately I now need to remember what I said and how to say it in Japanese, but I will give it a go soon!
